Certainly! Here are a few alternative modes of transportation you might consider when exploring Aberdare:

1. Walking - Aberdare is a fairly compact town, so walking is a great way to get around, especially if you want to take your time and enjoy the sights.

2. Public transport - There are several bus routes that run through Aberdare, including local and regional services. You can check the timetable and routes on the Traveline Cymru website.

3. Cycling - Aberdare has a number of cycling routes and trails, including the Aberdare Canal Trail, which is a scenic route that follows the route of the old Aberdare Canal.

4. Taxi - There are a number of taxi companies operating in Aberdare, and you can usually find them at designated taxi ranks or by calling ahead to make a booking.

5. Car rental - If you don't have a car, you can always rent one from a local car rental company. This will give you the freedom to explore Aberdare and the surrounding area at your own pace.
